channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: Supreme Court blocks order that found Texas congressional map is likely racially biased
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court has temporarily blocked a lower court ruling that found Texas' 2026 congressional redistricting plan pushed by President Trump likely discriminates on the basis of race.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. Supreme Court has temporarily blocked a lower court ruling that found Texas' 2026 congressional redistricting plan pushed by President Trump likely discriminates on the basis of race.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: After break with Trump, Marjorie Taylor Greene will resign
item.description: Republican Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, an "America First" conservative who has clashed with President Trump and her party, said Friday she would resign from Congress Jan. 5, 2026.
item.content:encoded:
Republican Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, an "America First" conservative who has clashed with President Trump and her party, said Friday she would resign from Congress Jan. 5, 2026.

(Image credit: Daniel Heuer)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: These fans have sung their way to the National Women's Soccer League finals
item.description: The Washington Spirit takes on Gotham FC on Saturday in San Jose, Calif.
item.content:encoded:
The Washington Spirit takes on Gotham FC on Saturday in San Jose, Calif.

(Image credit: Luke Chávez)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Senate Democrats are investigating the Kennedy Center for 'cronyism, corruption'
item.description: Senate Democrats say the new Kennedy Center leadership has led to "millions in lost revenue, luxury spending, and preferential treatment for Trump allies." The performing arts center denies the allegations.
item.content:encoded:
Senate Democrats say the new Kennedy Center leadership has led to "millions in lost revenue, luxury spending, and preferential treatment for Trump allies." The performing arts center denies the allegations.

(Image credit: The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: The female crash test dummy has been a long time coming — but she isn't here yet
item.description: After years of limbo, the U.S. government has given the green light to a crash test dummy based on the female body. But will it be used right away? Not so fast.
item.content:encoded:
After years of limbo, the U.S. government has given the green light to a crash test dummy based on the female body. But will it be used right away? Not so fast.

(Image credit: Paul Sancya)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Putin says U.S. plan for Ukraine could form the basis for a final peace settlement
item.description: The plan includes many of Russian President Vladimir Putin's demands. Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Friday that his country is at "truly one of the most difficult moments in our history."
item.content:encoded:
The plan includes many of Russian President Vladimir Putin's demands. Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Friday that his country is at "truly one of the most difficult moments in our history."

(Image credit: Kateryna Klochko)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: South Africa hosts G20 as tensions with U.S. flare amid boycott
item.description: The U.S. boycotts South Africa's G20 summit, sparking a diplomatic spat and throwing the global gathering into turmoil.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. boycotts South Africa's G20 summit, sparking a diplomatic spat and throwing the global gathering into turmoil.

(Image credit: Themba Hadebe)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: A new Miss Universe is crowned, weeks after she left a pageant event in protest
item.description: This year's Miss Universe competition, held in Bangkok, was marred by a series of dramatic incidents, from a contestant's livestreamed walkout to a now former judge's allegations of rigging.
item.content:encoded:
This year's Miss Universe competition, held in Bangkok, was marred by a series of dramatic incidents, from a contestant's livestreamed walkout to a now former judge's allegations of rigging.

(Image credit: Lillian Suwanrumpha)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Can vaping help wean people off cigarettes? Anti-smoking advocates are sharply split
item.description: Many think it's a dangerous ploy by the tobacco industry. But some say, with millions of deaths each year attributed to smoking cigarettes, it's the lesser of two evils.
item.content:encoded:
Many think it's a dangerous ploy by the tobacco industry. But some say, with millions of deaths each year attributed to smoking cigarettes, it's the lesser of two evils.

(Image credit: STR/AFP)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: 'Wicked: For Good' is in theaters, along with 'Zodiac Killer Project' and more
item.description: Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo are back in theaters for the second half of 'Wicked' this week, while Brendan Fraser plays an actor in stand-in roles in strangers' lives.
item.content:encoded:
Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo are back in theaters for the second half of 'Wicked' this week, while Brendan Fraser plays an actor in stand-in roles in strangers' lives.

(Image credit: Giles Keyte)
item.dc:creator: Bob Mondello
